intro: Cyrtochilum boyacensis, commonly known as the Boyacá orchid, is a rare and endemic orchid species native to Colombia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and intricate floral structure. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Cyrtochilum boyacensis thrives in shaded, humid environments, often growing on trees or rocks in montane forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
